thread.title: Gionee A1 to retail for Rs 19,999, pre-booking starts from March 31st
thread.title_full: Gionee A1 to retail for Rs 19,999, pre-booking starts from March 31st

title: Gionee A1 to retail for Rs 19,999, pre-booking starts from March 31st
text:
Gionee A1 to retail for Rs 19,999, pre-booking starts from March 31st Gionee A1 to retail for Rs 19,999, pre-booking starts from March 31st By - March 27, 2017 “The A1 is a high-end offering with an all-metal design, octa-core SoC, 4GB of RAM and 64GB of storage” 
Gionee first showcased its selfie and battery centric smartphone, the Gionee A1 , at MWC 2017 and subsequently launched the device last week in India. Now, the company has shed some light on its pricing and availability, along with announcing some exciting pre-order offers. The Gionee A1 has been priced at Rs 19,999 and will be available for pre-orders starting 31st March. The company has also unveiled a new campaign dubbed as #Selfiestan for the device . Pre-booking customers will be offered a two-year warranty on the phone along with attractive gifts such as a JBL headphone or a Swiss Military Bluetooth Speaker.To recap, the A1 flaunts a 16-megapixel front-facing shooter with f/2.0 aperture, 5P lens and a selfie flash. It also adorns a 13-megapixel primary shooter with phase detection autofocus and an LED flash. As for the other specs, the Gionee A1 ( first impressions ) offers a 5.5-inch full HD display with a pixel density of 401ppi. The phone is powered by a 1.8GHz octa-core MediaTek Helio P10 processor, mated to 4GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 64GB, further expandable up to 256GB by inserting a microSD card. The phone comes packed in an all-metal unibody design and i s being offered in three colour variants – black, grey and gold. 
The 4G LTE capable dual-sim device is fuelled by a 4,010mAh battery, which supports 18W rapid fast charging. The device also houses a fingerprint sensor onboard. Software-wise, it boots Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box with Gionee’s home-brewed Amigo 4.0 UI on top. Facebook Comments
